definition: lit. to loosen one's purse/fig. to give generously to help others
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity

sentences.english: Also, you have to make a charitable contribution to gain entry to these types of parties.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你还得慷慨解囊，方能参加这种慈善宴会。

sentences.english: We hope you will contribute unstintingly to the Gum my Bears Overtime Fund.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望诸位为“小熊糖加班基金”慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: She donated a certain sum of money from her private purse.
sentences.chinese: 她个人解囊捐助一笔钱。

sentences.english: Call it generosity between two strangers.
sentences.chinese: 你可以称为陌生人之间的慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: Also, you HAs to do a charitcapable contribution to gain entry to any types of parties.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你还得慷慨解囊，方能参加这种慈善宴会。

sentences.english: Please give generously to famine relief.
sentences.chinese: 请为饥荒赈款慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: I heard Mr. Genge is always ready to give the shirt of his back.
sentences.chinese: 我听说乔治先生对别人总是慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: I don't think the millionaire will loosen up this time.
sentences.chinese: 我认为那个百万富翁这回不会慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: Island life promised few temptations to the pocketbook.
sentences.chinese: 岛居生活很少有诱人解囊的刺激。

sentences.english: In China, many people, both young and old, gave money to help those who were in need.
sentences.chinese: 在我国，老老少少纷纷慷慨解囊，帮助灾民。

sentences.english: Norway is a generous funder of a huge number of good causes.
sentences.chinese: 挪威还为许多慈善事业慷慨解囊。

sentences.english: I heard Mr. Genge is always ready to give the shirt off his back.
sentences.chinese: 我听说乔治先生对别人总是慷慨解囊。

definition: to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
to empty one's pocket/to give everything to help sb
to donate goods (to a relief effort)/to contribute material
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to sacrifice one's wealth to save the state (idiom)
